categories.name: Transactions
categories.description: Endpoints for creating, sending, simulating, and querying the status of transactions.

endpoints.description: Sends a transaction.

params.name: transaction
params.description: The encoded transaction.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration object.

endpoints.description: Simulates a transaction.

params.name: transaction
params.description: The encoded transaction.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration object.

endpoints.description: Returns a transaction.

params.name: signature
params.description: The signature of the transaction.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration object.

endpoints.description: Returns the statuses of a list of signatures.

params.name: signatures
params.description: A list of transaction signatures.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration object.

endpoints.returns: A list of transaction status objects.

endpoints.description: Returns signatures for an address.

params.name: address
params.description: The address to get signatures for.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration object.

endpoints.description: Returns the fee for a message.

params.name: message
params.description: The encoded message.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration object.

endpoints.description: Returns recent prioritization fees.

params.name: addresses
params.description: A list of addresses to get fees for.

endpoints.description: Requests an airdrop of lamports to an account.

params.name: pubkey
params.description: The public key of the account to receive the airdrop.

params.name: lamports
params.description: The amount of lamports to airdrop.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration object.

endpoints.returns: The signature of the airdrop transaction.

endpoints.description: Subscribes to receive notifications for a given transaction signature.

params.name: signature
params.description: The transaction signature to subscribe to.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration for the subscription.

endpoints.description: Unsubscribes from signature notifications.

params.name: subscriptionId
params.description: The ID of the subscription to unsubscribe from.

categories.name: Accounts
categories.description: Endpoints for retrieving information about accounts, including balances, tokens, and program-owned accounts.

endpoints.description: Returns detailed information about an account given its public key. This method queries the blockchain for the account associated with the provided public key string. It can be used to inspect balances, ownership, and program-related metadata.

params.name: pubkey
params.description: A base-58 encoded string representing the account's public key.

params.name: config
params.description: Optional configuration that controls encoding, commitment level, data slicing, and other response details.

endpoints.returns: A `RpcResponse` containing an optional `UiAccount` object if the account exists. If the account does not exist, the response will contain `null`.

endpoints.description: Returns account information for multiple public keys in a single call. This method allows batching of account lookups for improved performance and fewer network roundtrips. It returns a list of `UiAccount` values in the same order as the provided public keys.

params.name: pubkeys
params.description: A list of base-58 encoded public key strings representing accounts to query.

params.name: config
params.description: Optional configuration to control encoding, commitment level, data slicing, etc.

endpoints.returns: A `RpcResponse` wrapping a vector of optional `UiAccount` objects. Each element in the response corresponds to the public key at the same index in the request. If an account is not found, the corresponding entry will be `null`.

endpoints.description: Returns the balance of the account of a given public key.

params.name: pubkey
params.description: Public key of account to query.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration object.

endpoints.description: Returns the balance of a token account, given its public key. This method fetches the token balance of an account, including its amount and user-friendly information (like the UI amount in human-readable format). It is useful for token-related applications, such as checking balances in wallets or exchanges.

params.name: pubkey
params.description: The base-58 encoded string of the public key of the token account.

params.name: commitment
params.description: Optional commitment configuration to specify the desired confirmation level of the query.

endpoints.returns: A `RpcResponse` containing the token balance in a `UiTokenAmount` struct. If the account doesn't hold any tokens or is invalid, the response will contain `null`.

endpoints.description: Returns the total supply of a token, given its mint address. This method provides the total circulating supply of a specific token, including the raw amount and human-readable UI-formatted values. It can be useful for tracking token issuance and verifying the supply of a token on-chain.

params.name: mint
params.description: The base-58 encoded string of the mint address for the token.

params.name: commitment
params.description: Optional commitment configuration to specify the desired confirmation level of the query.

endpoints.returns: A `RpcResponse` containing the total token supply in a `UiTokenAmount` struct. If the token does not exist or is invalid, the response will return an error.

endpoints.description: Returns all accounts owned by the specified program ID, optionally filtered and configured. This RPC method retrieves all accounts whose owner is the given program. It is commonly used to scan on-chain program state, such as finding all token accounts, order books, or PDAs owned by a given program. The results can be filtered using data size, memory comparisons, and token-specific criteria.

params.name: programId
params.description: Base-58 encoded program ID to scan for owned accounts.

params.name: config
params.description: Optional configuration object allowing filters, encoding options, context inclusion, and sorting of results.

endpoints.returns: A future resolving to a vector of `RpcKeyedAccount`s wrapped in an `OptionalContext`. Each result includes the account's public key and full account data.

endpoints.description: Returns the addresses and balances of the largest accounts for a given SPL token mint. This method is useful for analyzing token distribution and concentration, especially to assess decentralization or identify whales.

params.name: mint
params.description: The base-58 encoded public key of the mint account of the SPL token.

params.name: commitment
params.description: Optional commitment level to query the state of the ledger at different levels of finality.

endpoints.returns: A `BoxFuture` resolving to a `RpcResponse` with a vector of `RpcTokenAccountBalance`s, representing the largest accounts holding the token.

endpoints.description: Returns all SPL Token accounts owned by a specific wallet address, optionally filtered by mint or program. This endpoint is commonly used by wallets and explorers to retrieve all token balances associated with a user, and optionally narrow results to a specific token mint or program.

params.name: owner
params.description: The base-58 encoded public key of the wallet owner.

params.name: tokenAccountFilter
params.description: A `RpcTokenAccountsFilter` enum that allows filtering results by mint address or program ID.

params.name: config
params.description: Optional configuration for encoding, data slicing, and commitment.

endpoints.returns: A `BoxFuture` resolving to a `RpcResponse` containing a vector of `RpcKeyedAccount`s. Each entry contains the public key of a token account and its deserialized account data.

endpoints.description: Returns all SPL Token accounts that have delegated authority to a specific address, with optional filters. This RPC method is useful for identifying which token accounts have granted delegate rights to a particular wallet or program (commonly used in DeFi apps or custodial flows).

params.name: delegate
params.description: The base-58 encoded public key of the delegate authority.

params.name: tokenAccountFilter
params.description: A `RpcTokenAccountsFilter` enum to filter results by mint or program.

params.name: config
params.description: Optional `RpcAccountInfoConfig` for controlling account encoding, commitment level, etc.

endpoints.returns: A `BoxFuture` resolving to a `RpcResponse` containing a vector of `RpcKeyedAccount`s, each pairing a token account public key with its associated on-chain data.

endpoints.description: Returns the 20 largest accounts by lamport balance, optionally filtered by account type. This RPC endpoint is useful for analytics, network monitoring, or understanding the distribution of large token holders. It can also be used for sanity checks on protocol activity or whale tracking.

params.name: config
params.description: Optional configuration allowing for filtering on specific account types such as circulating or non-circulating accounts.

endpoints.returns: A future resolving to a `RpcResponse` containing a list of the 20 largest accounts by lamports, each represented as an `RpcAccountBalance`.

endpoints.description: Returns the minimum stake delegation.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration object.

endpoints.description: Returns the minimum balance for rent exemption.

params.name: data_len
params.description: The length of the account data.

params.name: commitment
params.description: The commitment level.

endpoints.returns: The minimum balance for rent exemption.

categories.name: Cheatcodes
categories.description: Custom endpoints for developers to manipulate on-chain state for testing and development purposes.

endpoints.description: A 'cheat code' method for developers to set or update an account in Surfpool. It allows for modifying lamports, data, owner, executable status, and rent epoch. This method is designed to help developers quickly test or update account attributes, such as lamports, program ownership, and executable status.

params.name: pubkey
params.description: The public key of the account to be updated, as a base-58 encoded string.

params.name: update
params.description: The `AccountUpdate` struct containing the fields to update the account.

endpoints.returns: A `RpcResponse<()>` indicating whether the account update was successful.

endpoints.description: A 'cheat code' method for developers to set or update a token account in Surfpool. It allows for updating properties like amount, delegate, state, delegated amount, and close authority. This is designed to help developers quickly modify token account properties like amounts, delegates, and authorities.

params.name: owner
params.description: The base-58 encoded public key of the token account's owner.

params.name: mint
params.description: The base-58 encoded public key of the token mint.

params.name: update
params.description: The `TokenAccountUpdate` struct containing the fields to update the token account.

params.name: token_program
params.description: Optional: The base-58 encoded address of the token program. Defaults to SPL Token program.

endpoints.returns: A `RpcResponse<()>` indicating whether the token account update was successful.

endpoints.description: Clones a program account from a source to a destination program ID. Since a program account points to a program data account (a PDA), this method clones the program data account as well. It gets the source program and data accounts, calculates the destination program data address, points the destination program account to it, and copies the data.

params.name: source_program_id
params.description: The base-58 encoded public key of the source program.

params.name: destination_program_id
params.description: The base-58 encoded public key of the destination program.

endpoints.returns: A `RpcResponse<()>` indicating whether the cloning was successful.

endpoints.description: Estimates the compute units that a given transaction will consume by simulating it without committing state changes. Returns an estimation of the compute units used, along with logs and potential errors.

params.name: transaction_data
params.description: A base64 encoded string of the `VersionedTransaction`.

params.name: tag
params.description: Optional tag for the transaction to group profiling results.

params.name: encoding
params.description: Optional encoding for returned account data (e.g., 'base64', 'jsonParsed').

endpoints.description: Retrieves all profiling results for a given tag.

params.name: tag
params.description: The tag to retrieve profiling results for.

endpoints.description: Writes program data at a specified offset for large program deployments. Supports writing programs of any size by batching data in chunks. Leverages RPC size limits (5MB) instead of transaction size limits.

params.name: program_id
params.description: The base-58 encoded public key of the program to write to.

params.name: data
params.description: Hex-encoded program data chunk to write.

params.name: offset
params.description: The byte offset at which to write this data chunk.

endpoints.returns: A `RpcResponse<()>` indicating whether the write was successful.

endpoints.description: A cheat code to register a scenario with account overrides.

params.name: scenario
params.description: The scenario object containing account overrides.

schema.id: String (A unique identifier for the scenario)
schema.name: String (A Human-readable name for the scenario)

overrides.description: Array of OverrideInstance objects, each containing account overrides.

schema.id: String (A unique identifier for this override instance)
schema.template_id: String (The identifier of the template this instance is based on)
schema.values: HashMap<String, serde_json::Value> (A hash map of field paths to override values. The field paths are a flat map to the account key being updated, from the IDL, using dot-notation to provide the path to the key. For example, to override a field 'amount' in an account 'myAccount', the path would be 'myAccount.amount'.)
schema.scenario_relative_slot: u64 (Relative slot when this override should be applied (relative to scenario registration slot))
schema.label: Option<String> (An optional label for this override instance)
schema.enabled: bool (Indicates whether this override instance is enabled)
schema.fetch_before_use: bool (Indicates whether to fetch the latest on-chain account data before applying overrides)
schema.account: String (The account this override instance is applied to)

params.name: slot
params.description: The base slot from which relative slot offsets are calculated. If omitted, uses the current slot.

endpoints.returns: A `RpcResponse<()>` indicating whether the write was successful.

categories.name: Node Health
categories.description: Endpoints for querying the health, identity, and version of the connected RPC node.

endpoints.description: Returns the health of the node.
endpoints.returns: A string indicating the health status.

endpoints.description: Returns the identity of the node.
Returns the current version of the server.
Returns the highest snapshot slot.
Returns the minimum ledger slot.
Returns the first available block.
Returns the start time of the node.
Returns the RPC address of the node.

categories.name: Network Health
categories.description: Endpoints for querying the overall status of the Solana network, including information about blocks, epochs, and validators.

endpoints.description: Returns the current slot.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration object.

endpoints.description: Returns the current block height.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration object.

endpoints.description: Returns the total number of transactions processed.

params.name: config

endpoints.description: Returns information about the current epoch.

params.name: config

endpoints.description: Returns the epoch schedule.

params.name: addresses

params.name: config

endpoints.returns: A list of inflation reward objects.

endpoints.description: Returns information about the current token supply on the network, including circulating and non-circulating amounts. This method provides visibility into the economic state of the chain by exposing the total amount of tokens issued, how much is in circulation, and what is held in non-circulating accounts.

params.name: config
params.description: Optional `RpcSupplyConfig` that allows specifying commitment level and whether to exclude the list of non-circulating accounts from the response.

endpoints.returns: A future resolving to a `RpcResponse` containing a `RpcSupply` struct with supply metrics in lamports.

endpoints.description: Returns commitment levels for a given block (slot). This method provides insight into how many validators have voted for a specific block and with what level of lockout. This can be used to analyze consensus progress and determine finality confidence.

params.name: block
params.description: The target slot (block) to query.

endpoints.returns: A `RpcBlockCommitment` containing a `BlockCommitmentArray`, which is an array of 32 integers representing the number of votes at each lockout level for that block. Each index corresponds to a lockout level (i.e., confidence in finality).

endpoints.description: Returns the current vote accounts.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration object.

endpoints.description: Returns recent performance samples.

params.name: limit
params.description: The maximum number of samples to return.

endpoints.returns: A list of performance sample objects.

endpoints.description: Returns information about the nodes in the cluster.
endpoints.returns: A list of contact information objects.

endpoints.description: Returns a block.

params.name: slot
params.description: The slot of the block to return.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration object.

endpoints.description: Returns a list of blocks.

params.name: start_slot
params.description: The starting slot.

params.name: end_slot

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration object.

endpoints.description: Returns a list of blocks with a limit.

params.name: start_slot
params.description: The starting slot.

params.name: limit

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration object.

endpoints.description: Returns the timestamp of a block.

params.name: slot

endpoints.description: Returns the leader schedule for an epoch.

params.name: config
